verses.roman:
lohāke yāvat sparśi' hema nāhi kare
tāvat sparśa-maṇi keha cinite nā pāre

synonyms: lohāke—iron; yāvat—as long as; sparśi'-touching; hema—gold; nāhi—not; kare—transforms; tāvat—until then; sparśa-maṇi—the touchstone; keha—someone; cinite—to recognize; nā—not; pāre—is able.
translation: As long as it does not turn iron into gold by its touch, no one can recognize an unknown stone to be a touchstone.
